title: Meet Caroline Ellison, The ‘Fake Charity Nerd Girl’ Behind The FTX Collapse
author: David Jeans
description: Alameda Research CEO Caroline Ellison is a math whiz who loves Harry Potter, fringe political philosophy and taking big risks. She is also one of the supporting players in Sam Bankman-Fried's FTX catastrophe.

title: ‘The Devil In Nerd’s Clothes’: How Sam Bankman-Fried’s Cult Of Genius Fooled Everyone
author: David Jeans
description: Crypto insiders paint a picture of a charismatic tech founder who became the darling of high-powered investors, even as he was brazen about his cryptocurrency exchange’s shaky business model and kept the books closed to all but a few confidants.

title: Fintech 50 2022: The Newcomers
author: Jeff Kauflin
description: For our seventh annual Fintech 50, 25 of our picks have never appeared on the list. Crypto companies and startups trying to make banking cheaper and more accessible for small businesses made a particularly strong showing.

title: FTX.US Accounting Firm Armanino Ends Crypto Audit Practice
author: Emily Mason
description: Armanino is dropping clients as it winds down its cryptocurrency audit business amid criticism for missing red flags at collapsed crypto exchange.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried’s Donations To Effective Altruism Nonprofits Tied To An Oxford Professor Are At Risk Of Being Clawed Back
author: John Hyatt
description: Bankman-Fried created a virtuous image to go with his crypto activities by adhering to a do-gooder movement that stresses giving your money away. Now groups associated with the movement are tied to millions of dollars that could be clawed back in bankruptcy proceedings.

title: Ethereum Scaling Company StarkWare Quadruples Valuation To $8 Billion Amid Bear Market
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: The Tel Aviv, Israel-based firm has raised a $100 million Series D financing round.

title: Animoca Brands Raises $110 Million From Temasek, GGV And Boyu Capital As It Mulls Possible IPO
author: Zinnia Lee
description: Temasek, GGV and Boyu Capital will engage and advise Animoca Brands on organization, process and governance that allows it to become “pre-IPO ready,” the company said.

title: SVB Capital Owned Pieces Of Top VC Firms. With A Sale Ongoing, Their Future Is In Flux
author: Alex Konrad
description: Firms like Accel, a16z, Index and Sequoia can usually control who buys a stake in their blue-chip funds. With SVB Capital for sale, that won’t likely be the case.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried Promised Millions To Nonprofits. Some Say They Didn’t Get The Money.
author: John Hyatt
description: The collapse of crypto exchange FTX is causing headaches to those promised grants from its foundation. It also cuts off a key source of financing for a philanthropic movement called Effective Altruism and its University of Oxford boosters.

title: Stripe, Deloitte, Sullivan & Cromwell Are Among 53 FTX Advisors, Vendors And Bankers Weathering Exchange’s Collapse
author: Javier Paz
description: Relative to other crypto exchanges, transparency and regulatory compliance were virtues for Bankman-Fried’s FTX.  Here’s a glimpse of the exchange’s operations, according to its own general counsel, as of August 2022.

title: BlackRock And Citadel Deny Trading Cratering Stablecoin
author: Michael del Castillo
description: In response to widespread rumors, hedge fund giant Citadel Securities and asset manager BlackRock say they don't trade any of the notorious TerraUSD, a stablecoin that lost its peg to the dollar, wiping out $25 billion from the underlying asset.

title: At Least 20 Billionaires Got Burnt By Sam Bankman-Fried And FTX Cofounder Gary Wang
author: Matt Durot
description: The FTX wonderkind and his cofounder are no longer billionaires. And the sudden collapse of their cryptocurrency exchange has hit the fortunes of at least 20 of the world’s richest people.

title: The Future Of Crypto And Blockchain: Fintech 50 2022
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: A record nine cryptocurrency-focused companies made it onto the Forbes Fintech 50 list this year. Collectively, the trailblazers have raised $6.5 billion in venture capital funding.

title: No More Smartphone Or League Of Legends For Sam Bankman-Fried
author: Derek Saul
description: New bail conditions prohibit the chronically online Bankman-Fried from accessing some of his favored technology ahead of his October fraud trial.

title: Creators Of Andreessen Horowitz-Backed Cryptocurrency Filecoin Fires 21% Of Staff After Raising Record $205 Million
author: Michael del Castillo
description: One of Web3’s earliest pioneers, Protocol Labs, has laid off 89 people, or more than a fifth of its total staff according to documents reviewed by Forbes, provided by one of the employees, who asked not to be identified so as to not harm their future job searches.

title: ‘In Huge Trouble’—Leak Reveals $10 Billion Earthquake Could Be About To Cause Bitcoin And Ethereum Price Chaos
author: Billy Bambrough
description: Fears are swirling that $10 billion bitcoin and crypto giant Digital Currency Group (DCG) could be in trouble...

title: The Light Is Flashing Yellow For Crypto In Singapore
author: Zennon Kapron
description: Crypto firms have flocked to Singapore less because of anything specific the city-state has done and more because of what it has not forbidden.

title: Andreessen Horowitz's Crypto Lobbying Blitz Is Paying Off
author: David Jeans
description: Partners at A16Z held a fundraiser for New York congressman Ritchie Torres. Soon after, he pressured an industry group that threatened to derail a portfolio company.

title: Sequoia Leads $37 Million Series B Funding Round In Singapore Metaverse Startup
author: Jayde Cheung
description: Singapore-based metaverse startup BUD claims to be one of the largest metaverse UGC platforms in the world.

title: Singapore’s Temasek Writes Off $275 Million Investment In Failed FTX Crypto Exchange
author: Jonathan Burgos
description: Singapore state-owned investment firm Temasek said Thursday it has decided to write off its $275 million investment FTX, nearly a week after the cryptocurrency exchange filed for bankruptcy.

title: Sequoia, Y Combinator And A16Z Under Scrutiny In Congress Over ‘Tech Bro’ Culture
author: Jason Brett
description: This coming Thursday in Congress, the Task Force On Financial Technology is holding a hearing titled “Combatting Tech Bro Culture: Understanding Obstacles to Investments in Diverse-Owned Fintechs.”

title: The Leadership Risks Of Sam Bankman-Fried’s Double-Or-Nothing Philosophy
author: Dr. Gleb Tsipursky
description: Imagine betting on human civilization: there’s a 51% chance it doubles, and a 49% chance that it disappears. Would you play that, double or nothing? The vast majority of us would not, but Sam Bankman-Fried is different.

title: Sequoia China-Backed Crypto Financial Services Firm Hits $2 Billion Valuation
author: Zinnia Lee
description: Babel Finance's latest funding round comes as the crypto market is struggling to recover from the spectacular collapse of TerraUSD and Luna.

title: Billions Of FTX Assets In Limbo As Exchange Follows Voyager Into Bankruptcy
author: Maria Gracia Santillana Linares
description: Once the apparent savior of a rival, Sam Bankman-Fried’s conglomerate needs a hero of its own.

title: Animoca’s Yat Siu Says Crypto Is Becoming A ‘Safety Net’ Amid Banking Crisis
author: Zinnia Lee
description: The chairman of Asia’s largest blockchain investor thinks volatile cryptocurrencies are a relatively safe investment as the traditional financial world is rocked by the Credit Suisse turmoil and the failure of a string of U.S. banks.

title: FTX Fiasco: Crypto Mogul Leon Li’s Firm Has $18 Million Stuck On Sam Bankman-Fried’s Bankrupt Exchange
author: Zinnia Lee
description: Leon Li is best known for founding Huobi Group, the operator of one of the world’s largest crypto exchanges, in 2013.

title: FTX Raised Funds Using The Opaque Form D Market: “Lite” Regulation Has Costs
author: Shivaram Rajgopal
description: The Form D market also financed Theranos and has surpassed public IPOs as a way to raise investor funds in recent times.  Opacity in Form D fund raising has benefits and costs. I suspect that the Form D market is under regulated.

title: Crypto Market Notches 12% Weekly Gain As Old-School Financial Firms Come Out To Play
author: Mitchell Martin
description: Bitcoin cash token soars 66%; Spot-market ETFs, new digital exchange revive sentiment.

title: Broken Banks Silvergate And SVB Put Pressure On Crypto, Leaders End Week Down 10%
author: Maria Gracia Santillana Linares
description: As SVB joined Silvergate in closing, digital-asset financing suffers crisis of confidence.

title: BlockFi Bankruptcy In The Latest FTX Casualty
author: Q.ai - Powering a Personal Wealth Movement
description: Crypto platform BlockFi has filed for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy in New Jersey, citing exposure to FTX as a major factor in their collapse.

title: Bitcoin Prices Retain Bulk Of Gains After Climbing To 5-Month High
author: Charles Bovaird
description: Bitcoin prices have shown strength lately, holding on to most of their recent upside after rising to their loftiest value in over five months. The digital currency has been rising lately in spite of industry headwinds, including the FTX collapse and Genesis Capital declaring bankruptcy.

title: Is Sam Bankman-Fried Crypto's Bernie Madoff? This Crypto Hedge Fund Manager Thinks So
author: Jacob Wolinsky
description: One thing goes wrong, and many things will go wrong, all together at the same time."
